{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-10-06T21:32:03.000Z", "description": "

Role: Site Reliability Engineer/Architect

Location: Frisco, TX (remote till pandemic)

Type: FTE


This is a highly visible global role based in HCL Cloud Native Labs where you will be responsible for implementing the Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) journey for the world\u2019s largest and most successful enterprises.

This position requires a mix of strong technical credibility, a \u2018Cloud Native\u2019 mindset and exceptional customer-facing skills.

You will be a technical heavyweight and thought-leader, comfortable in the following domains:

\u00b7        DevOps

\u00b7        Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

You will:

\u00b7        Showcase world-class Reliability Engineering techniques and implementations

\u00b7        Help clients drive organisational change enabled via SRE and associated behaviours

\u00b7        Act as Trusted Advisor, guiding senior technical leaders as they implement SRE and similar approaches.

\u00b7        Get deeply involved in hands-on engineering tasks, enabling and supporting complex Cloud Native solutions.

\u00b7        Coach modern reliability engineering and DevOps techniques. Help experienced teams adopt Cloud Native skills.

\u00b7        Engineer new, next-generation solutions based on modern Cloud Native principles.

\u00b7        Help educate and share best practice approaches to modern SRE techniques and approaches.

  • Create custom learning paths; select and prepare materials to guide learning.
  • Perform a thought-leader role, advancing the art-of-the-possible, author papers, be passionate about the domain and participate in industry dialogue.

 

Required Mandatory Skills / Experience

 

\u00b7        An experienced SRE working in \u2018Cloud Native\u2019 environments.

\u00b7        Hands-on experience with complete SRE & DevOps Lifecycle & Tooling sets

\u00b7        Hands-on experience in private, hybrid and multi-cloud environments.

\u00b7        IAC experience (writing and debugging) with tools like Terraform or Ansible

\u00b7        This role is 50% Development and 50% ops (building things is a must)

\u00b7        Hands-on Kubernetes or OpenShift or Docker experience

\u00b7        Consultative mindset, experience acting in an advisory role.

\u00b7        Superior written and verbal communication skills.

\u00b7        Hands on coding ability in Java / Python - writing your own programs / scripts from scratch

\u00b7        Strong familiarity with 1 of the public cloud providers like GCP / AWS or Azure

\u00b7        Hand-s on dashboarding / alerting experience with monitoring solutions like Stackdriver / ELK / Prometheus or Grafana or something similar

\u00b7        Hands on experience in SRE metrics like SLI, SLO, SLAs, Error Budgets etc

\u00b7        Hands on experience with Git and release management

\u00b7        Ability and willingness to mentor junior staff and share knowledge.

\u00b7        Advanced problem-solving experience

\u00b7        Exposure to Agile / Scrum / XP development methodologies

\u00b7        In-depth understanding of CI/CD

 

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

\u00b7        7+ years of SRE/DevOps Consulting

\u00b7        Deployment of highly available, large-scale & reliable Cloud Native applications.

\u00b7        Experience with multiple programming languages, such as: Java, C#, Python, Node.js and Go.

\u00b7        Architectural, Engineering or DevOps Certification with one or more Public Cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP).

\u00b7        Coaching / Advisory experience. Helping Developers and Operations professionals master Reliability Engineering & DevOps techniques particularly in relation to Cloud Native software applications.

\u00b7        Extra curricula engineering passion (e.g. active open source contributor).

\u00b7        Experience with designing and building applications using Microservices together with Container and Serverless technologies

\u00b7        Experience with configuration management and automation technologies (e.g. Terraform, Chef, Puppet, Salt, or Ansible).

 

BASIC SKILLS/EDUCATION

\u00b7        BS level technical degree or equivalent experience; Computer Science or Engineering background preferred; Master\u2019s Degree desired.

\u00b7        Excellent communication and presentation skills.
